entry.title: INTERSTELLAR
entry.content:
And that makes me want to follow my heart. Maybe we’ve spent too long trying to figure all this out with theory.

You’re a scientist, Brand.

So listen to me…when I say that love isn’t something we invented. It’s…observable, powerful. It has to mean something.

Love has meaning, yes. Social utility, social bonding, child rearing…

We love people who have died. Where’s the social utility in that?

None.

Maybe it means something more, something we can’t…yet understand. Maybe it’s some evidence, some…artifact of a higher dimension that we can’t consciously perceive. I’m drawn across the universe to someone I haven’t seen in a decade…who I know is probably dead. Love is the one thing we’re capable of perceiving that transcends dimensions of time and space. Maybe we should trust that, even if we can’t understand it yet. All right, Cooper…yes…the tiniest possibility of seeing Wolf again excites me. That doesn’t mean I’m wrong.

—INTERSTELLAR

所以我想要跟着我的心走。也许我们花了太多的时间，试着用理论解释一切。

你是一个科学家，布兰德。

听我说，我们要明白，爱不是人类发明的东西，它一直存在，而且很强大，它是有意义的。

爱是有意义的，没错。社会效益、人际交往、繁衍后代……

我们也爱那些逝去的人，这有什么社会效益？

没有。

也许意味着更多，更多我们还无法理解的。也许爱是某种证据，来自更高维度文明而且我们目前无法感知。我风尘仆仆穿越宇宙寻找了一个消失十年的人，我也知道，他可能已经死了。爱是我们唯一能够感知的，超越时空维度的事物。或许我们应该相信它，尽管我们还不能真正地理解它。好吧，库珀，我承认，能见到爱德蒙斯的机会再渺茫我也不放弃。这不意味着我错了。

——《星际穿越》
